properties.name: additionalText
properties.description: Describes if this accordion panel will display additional information to the right of the header.

properties.name: badgeCount
properties.description:
Number of count to be shown in badge, it is undefined by
default (no badge count).

properties.name: caretOnRight
properties.description: Describes if the caret is moved to right side, left by default. Set by parent component (eds-accordion).

properties.name: filledHeader
properties.description: Describes if the header receives a background color and removed borders. Set by parent component (eds-accordion).

properties.name: headerIcon
properties.description: If the panel is opened or closed

properties.name: headingText
properties.description: Text to display in the item heading

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
The following properties are accepted:
{
 'loadMethod': ,
 'filename': ,
 'svgString': ,
 'svgStyle': ,
 'baseSvgPath':
}
Refer to `eds-icon` for more information on those properties.  Additionally,
three properties on this object control the behavior in the select
component.

properties.name: iconOnRight
properties.description: Describes if the (optional) icon is moved to right side, left by default. Set by parent component (eds-accordion).

properties.name: isPreload
properties.description: Active the progressive loading skeleton classes, it is false by default.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: If the panel is opened or closed

properties.name: panelPadding
properties.description:
Padding rules applied to the accordion item panel contents.
By default, panelPadding is 'all'.

Valid values include:

* all: UX-defined padding around the panel content
* horizontal-only: include UX-defined horizontal padding, but no vertical padding
* vertical-only: include UX-defined vertical padding, but no horizontal padding
* none: remove all padding which allows for maximum content area in the panel

properties.name: secondaryHeadingText
properties.description: Text to display in the item heading below the first heading

properties.name: uniqueId
properties.description:
Unique id for the accordion item. This input is not required, but
recommended.  If not set, it will use the value from the required `headingText` input.
